section.name: How do I get involved in Plexus development?

subsection.name: Interested in being a part of Plexus development team.... that's great!
subsection.p:
You can contribute:
by asking questions and sharing ideas on Plexus mailing lists and on IRC
by picking up issues of interest and submitting patches with Plexus team.

subsection.name: Reporting Issues
subsection.p:
Before reporting please chose the correct project :
Plexus Container issue Plexus (PLX)
Plexus Components issue Plexus Components (PLXCOMP)
Plexus Redback issue Plexus Redback (PLXREDBACK)
Plexus Redback issue Plexus Utils (PLXUTILS)

subsection.name: Creating and submitting a patch
subsection.p: First you need to create an issue in JIRA in the correct project. (ensure you have made a svn up before).
If your patch is a improvement or a new feature : add a junit.
subsection.source: svn diff > projectName-issueId.patch (where projectName in PLX, PLXCOMP, PLXREDBACK, PLXUTILS)
subsection.p: Attached the patch to the jira issue.

subsection.name: Plexus Code Style
subsection.p: The following sections show how to set up the code style for Maven in IDEA and Eclipse. It is strongly preferred that patches use this style before they are spplied

subsection.name: IntelliJ IDEA 4.5+
subsection.p: Download maven-idea-codestyle.xml and copy it to ~/.IntelliJIDEA/config/codestyles then restart IDEA. On Windows, try C:\Documents and Settings<username>\.IntelliJIDEA\config\codestyles
After this, restart IDEA and open the settings to select the new code style.

subsection.name: Eclipse 3.2+
subsection.p: After this, select Window > Preferences, and open up the configuration for Java > Code Style > Code Formatter. Click on the button labeled Import... and select the file you downloaded. Give the style a name, and click OK.
